result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin James Albright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Justin James Albright is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Justin James Albright was found guilty of Mistreatment of Animals/Cause Death [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Probation to commence today August 17, 2015.
Defendant to sign up for Probation in the St. Croix County Jail.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF98.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF98.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant not to possess or own any domestic animals.
-Defendant can file for furloughs with the Court for treatment outside of the St. Croix County Jail.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF: Justin James Albright appeared from jail, pro se.  Ben Anderson in court from probation and parole.  Court called.  Ben Anderson makes statement.  DE is not complying with his mental health requirements.  Probation is asking for 30 days conditional jail time.  DE makes statement.  Court sanctions the DE to 30 days in the St. Croix County Jail as a condition of probation which began on 02/22/2017. Court adjourned.  lw
Filed by D. Albright. Requesting early release with attachments.. Per EJL, denied. km

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp, DF: Justin James Albright appeared from jail.  Court called at 1:52 p.m.  Hearing regarding JOC.  ADA Nieskes makes statement.  Court will grant change in JOC.  Court will change the minutes from the SEH on 08/17/15 to:

- DE sentenced to 6 months in the St. Croix County Jail conditional time that will be consecutive with time currently serving on 14CM449
Filed by Atty Kemp. Requesting the court to Stay 90 Days of Jail time. km
Hearing at 09-10-2015 01:45 pm
Filed by Def. Re: amount of Jail credit. km
E: DOC. eif
c: Def, Atty, DA, Baldwin PD, Jail & E: Probation. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Francis D. Collins, DF ATTY: Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp, DF: Justin James Albright appeared from jail.  Court called at 9:15 a.m.  Set for SEH.  Court advises it has reviewed the psychiatric report from the doctor.  PSI has been received and reviewed by the attorneys.  ADA Collins recites the State's recommendation.  Attorney Kemp makes sentencing arguments.  DE makes statement.  Court orders:

S/W 3 years probation with conditions
- DE sentenced to 6 months in the St. Croix County Jail conditional time that will be consecutive with time currently serving on 14CM450
- Probation to begin today 08/17/15
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA and DE to follow through with any recommended treatment
- DE can file for furloughs with the court for treatment outside of the St. Croix County Jail
- DE not to possess or own any domestic animals
- Court costs of $268.00 and $250.00 for DNA Surcharge
- DE to sign up for probation in the St. Croix County Jail
- 20 days to appeal
to EJL w/o file
Filed by Def. Re: case. km                to EJL w/o file
signed by EJL 5/21/15 - fax probation. eif
Sentencing hearing on August 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.

*AMENDED*

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- DE not to possess or be in the presence of any domestic animals

 - It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,   Gina M., Alexis F. or the residence at 830 11th Avenue #5 Baldwin WI & 962 80th Avenue Roberts WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kevin H. Gehler, DF ATTY: Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp   DF:  Justin James Albright appeared from jail.  Court called at 9:47 a.m. Includes case 14CM450, 14CM449, 14CM560 & 15CF98.  ADA Gehler recites agreement.  Sentencing arguments.  DE makes statement.  Court has reviewed the Revocation Packet.  Crt Orders:

Ct. 2 in 14CM449
- DE sentenced to 9 months in St. Croix County Jail concurrent 
- Huber granted for any medical treatement including psychological
- Credit for 92 days served

Ct. 1 in 14CM449
- DE sentenced to 90 days in the St. Croix County Jail concurrent to Ct. 2 in 14CM449
- Huber granted for any medical treatement including psychological

Ct. 4 in 14CM560 
- DE sentenced to 90 days in the St. Croix County Jail Concurrent to Ct. 1 & Ct. 2 in 14CM449 
- Huber granted for any medical treatement including psychological

14CM450
DE sentenced to 9 months in the St. Croix County Jail concurrent to Ct. 1 & Ct. 2 in 14CM449 & Ct. 4 in 14CM560
- Huber granted for any medical treatement including psychological
- Restitution to St. Croix County in the amount of $637.69.  Court orders amount to be converted to a civil judgment

- Court orders any monies on file for the 14CM449, 14CM450 & 14CM560 to be moved over to the 15CF98 file.
- 20 days to appeal

Court costs to be determined during the 15CF98 sentencing.  Court moves to plea for 15CF98.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CF98.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF98. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CF98. Court orders a PSI for the DE.  SEH will be set after court receives PSI.  Court modifies the bond to a signature bond.  Court adjourned at 10:15 a.m. lw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
signed by Def & Atty. eif
to EJL from Defendant. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Matthew L Hartung, DF ATTY: Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp, DF: Justin James Albright appeared from jail.  Court called. Includes case 14CM450 (Set for Motion Hearing to Revoke) & 15CF98, 14CM449 & 14CM560 (STC).  Court called at 1:16 p.m.  ADA Hartung makes statement regarding revocation on the 14CM450 file.  Court has not reviewed the Revocation Packet.  Attorney Kemp makes argument not to revoke the DJOC.  Court grants the motion to revoke and finds the DE adjudicated guilty in 14CM450.  Set out for SEH on 14CM450, 14CM449 & 14CM560 and a STC on 15CF98.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 09:15 am.
filed by Atty Kemp w/attachments (sealed). eif
